attributes.additional_details: Veterinary Nurses deserve to have a significant rise in pay as they look after patients which cannot speak, restless hours of work and the pay they are receiving is unfair only the most experienced Veterinary Nurses receive a somewhat decent pay, in cost of living crises the average pay of 24-30k is far less for what the Veterinary Nurses do.
attributes.background: All Veterinary Nurses deserve to have a significant pay rise as they are underpaid for all the work they do along with all the roles in the Veterinary profession.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about pay for veterinary nurses are a matter for individual veterinary practices, not the UK Government or Parliament.
